message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with polar codes, which are a type of error-correcting codes used in information theory. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves probabilistic analysis and martingales, which are topics in cs.CC (Computational Complexity) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). The paper's focus on achieving exponentially small error probabilities suggests that it may also fall under cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) or cs.LG (Machine Learning).
